page.title: 01Derwentwater
page.content: This beautiful area of Derwentwater is within the Lake District national park.It includes the greater part of Derwentwater & its east & west shores,looking towards the Borrowdale Valley.A boat service in the summer months connects points around the lake for the conveniece of visitors & residents.There are also access points to the lake & car parks at intervals along the roads on both shores.The islands most of the lake & land here is owned by the National Trust.On the west shore Brandelhow Woods was the first area of land purchased by them & its deciduous trees reach down to the lakeside from the slopes of Catbells whose falls show signs of erosion caused by many walkers. On the east shore Ashness Bridge is one of the most popular landmarks in the National Park.Sheep graze on the fells
